intro: Rhynchosia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf snakeweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its seed pods are slender and contain several small, angular seeds. Rhynchosia stenophylla is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
